intro: Brachylaena stellulifera, commonly known as the star-leaf tree, is a shrub or small tree native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its distinctive, star-shaped leaves that are arranged in a whorl at the ends of the branches. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers that are clustered in spherical inflorescences, giving it its common name. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Brachylaena stellulifera is valued for its ornamental appearance and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
